comment: Dr.Head was extremely helpful & was ALWAYS accessible outside of class. I cannot count the number of times I texted her on MS TEAMS at random hours on weekends and she responded within minutes to a few hours. She is very heavy on group work she doesn't do the typical lecture. Her O-chem exams are difficult though.
rating_tags: Tough grader--Participation matters--Accessible outside class

comment: Don't take her unless you're ready for really harsh grading and confusing lab assignments.
Youd be better off learning organic chemistry from an orangutan.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: She lacks the education needed to teach even general chemistry but for her to teach organic is a nightmare. She has an education degree and knows nothing about chemistry. She compensates for her laughable lack of chemistry knowledge with a flipped classroom. She has messed up a concept every lecture and will not notice until a student corrects it.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: I took her lab online and it was not bad. If you do the work and take the time to complete the labs in a timely manner then you will pass the class with an A. She answers all questions and makes time outside of class time if you don't understand something. I would take her again very understanding as well!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Dr. Head was a great professor for me. I had her for Chem1211L for the summer 2020 semester, and I felt she was more than fair and almost lenient with some work submitted. If you talked to her she would spell out what she wanted and it never left me too confused. However, my peers did not have the same opinions. Communicate and you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--Accessible outside class--Caring

comment: Awful professor. Avoid at all costs. Doesn't teach.

Super nice person, BUT she is an incredibly hard grader! I kid you not, I usually make As and Bs in science classes but she is making it extremely hard for me to pull off a B. She is so picky when it comes to grading and for the sake of your mental health and well being I recommend you not taking this professor.
Shes a nice person but grades extremely harsh and is very picky about lab
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Skip class? You won't pass.--Tough grader

comment: My class was the first Time that Professor Head taught Organic Chemistry and I think she did pretty well. There were quite a bit of mistakes as she was relearning the course material with us. She gave lots of extra credit to help with our failing test grades. A couple more semesters and I'm sure she'd be a solid choice for Orgo 1.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Accessible outside class--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: Shes nice in person, but super harsh when it comes to grading. No partial credit on exams & she grades homework when you come into class. She also says homework is a worksheet, but it was usually a 6+ page packet of problems.
rating_tags: Lots of homework--Tough grader

comment: Great gal! best teachers for organic chemistry. Class is hard but you know that! she has a flipped classroom so you watch lecture videos on your own time and come to class ready to practice problems and worksheets. 4 test plus final. final can replace all lowest grades which means you have a lot of room to improve!! Make sure you do study guides!!!
rating_tags: Respected--Clear grading criteria--Amazing lectures

comment: Took her for orgo lab. be prepared for a weekly quiz. She's helpful if you reach out to her.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--GRADED BY FEW THINGS

comment: Professor Head is amazing. I had her for AMP Chem 1211. The class isn't super difficult but if you want an A, you'll have to work for it. Weekly quizzes, helpful TAs and review sessions, accessible office hours, and long lectures. You don't need the textbook. Take good notes and do the study guides for an easy B, possible A.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: TAKE HER CLASSES. She helped me so much and is such an incredible teacher. She goes step by step on everything in class and pauses and answers questions for anyone who is confused without criticizing. She does make a lot of mistakes but I think she does that to keep us on our toes ;)
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--Caring--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: I failed her class the first time I took it but it was all my fault. I took her class specifically again bc I knew if I actually paid attention and studied I would do great. She is super sweet and is amazing at her job. She actually teaches, unlike most professors here, and is accessible almost all the time for questions. TAKE HER CLASS
rating_tags: Respected--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: There are homework checks every week so you have to do your homework as well as the mastering chemistry assignments that are due every Sunday. Going to SI and seeing her during office hours can count towards your grade so take advantage of it. It's a difficult class if you don't pay attention during lectures and her tests aren't easy either.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY--LECTURE HEAVY

comment: Very caring professor. A great teacher and she wants everyone to do well. She offers plenty of help outside of class. Tests are somewhat difficult but if you study you will do well.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: I thought her class is very difficult before i took. her online quiz was rough for me but fortunately she drops the lowest 2 quizzes so don't worry. She gives a lot of extra credit! Her test is easier than quizzes so even if you make bad grade in quiz, if you do well on the quiz you can remain easy A. Test is MC. Take this class and study a lot!
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--EXTRA CREDIT

comment: HER CLASS IS A FLIPPED CLASSROOM. Please keep that in mind. It took me so long to realize. Her lectures didnt help much because she sped through it at 8 AM so READ THE BOOK and use the unit guide to study. she does quizzes every morning and counts it as attendance so be on time or on a device if you dont go. I baaaaarely made an A in there.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: she gives SO much homework. you have to teach yourself the material. she will help you, but going to class was pointless except she gives quizzes almost daily. she gives a VERY short time for quizzes, and ends them even if the whole class needs more time. the workload is insane. final replaces any lower test grades, drops two quizzes.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: She was a nice lady, but her teaching style is very scattered and confusing. The best way to pass is to read the text book yourself. The online lectures she posts are helpful as well. Go to office hours and SI.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Dr. Head is an extremely nice lady, her class is flipped style, so if you aren't good at that teaching style i would not recommend. Her office hours are a must and she is really good at explaining things there. In class, you focus on worksheets and if you know how to do them you will be set. Also, the quizzes are taken in groups.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS

comment: a nice lady but not easy. Tests are not a lot of questions and they are incredibly easy to fail. would not take again, good luck.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Professor Head is a nice lady but her classes are not helpful. You are expected to learn everything out of the classroom and take tests at the beginning of each class. I spent a good amount of time studying for tests and still ended up doing poorly on them. Wouldn't recommend the class to anyone who isn't willing to dedicate themselves to the class

Professor Head doesn't lecture AT ALL and expects you to come to class knowing the information. The first thing you'll do is take a quiz for a grade then go over Questions and the quiz AFTER. Worst style of teaching of you don't have a lot of extra time on your hands. Reading the textbook is key and even then class doesn't help. Switch teachers!!!
rating_tags: Tough Grader--Get ready to read--LOTS OF HOMEWORK

comment: Do not take this class if you want to pass. She does not teach and expects you to know everything without going over it first. Very rude when you try to email her for help. Do yourself a favor and find a different professor.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: flipped class style. Meaning she will give you multiple 10 minute videos to watch. She'll assign mastering chem before she teaches the chapters. Professor Head almost never helped me with my problems. Thankfully she had SI students that helped me. 50 min lectures consisted of 15min lecture, 15 min go formative, 15min checkformastery worksheets.
rating_tags: Tough Grader--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--SO MANY PAPERS

comment: Flipped class style, where you watch videos outside of class and come to class with questions. worksheets and quizzes everyday in class.
rating_tags: Get ready to read--Participation matters--Skip class? You won't pass.

comment: Dr. Head makes you watch videos before every class and then you come to class asking questions and doing worksheets. She is a great teacher and is always there to help. There is a lot of homework but in the end it helps you from passing.
rating_tags: LOTS OF HOMEWORK--ACCESSIBLE OUTSIDE CLASS--Caring

comment: Don't take her if you benefit from lectures. I struggled in this class to make a B because I ended up having to teach myself 95% of it. She does flipped-style of teaching where you learn outside of class and practice in class. She is really nice, but that doesn't help you learn the material. Her tests were so hard, and ACS final counts as A LOT.
rating_tags: Skip class? You won't pass.--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--TEST HEAVY

comment: Dr. Head does a flipped classroom Instead of being lectured all period and leaving with questions, you come with questions and basically get an hour have them answered. Daily mini quizzes with your group are a nice grade booster. Lots of grades: home work, tests, and watching the videos. Hard to fail if you just put in a little effort.
rating_tags: Gives good feedback--LOTS OF HOMEWORK--Clear grading criteria

comment: Flipped classroom style meaning you basically teach yourself. She is just there to handout tests. quizzes everyday including days you don't have class. Gobs of mastering chemistry homework (online). 20/21 question tests very easy to fail.

Dr. Head was one of the worst professors I've ever had. Her class was an extremely hard class and instead of teaching the material she made us teach it to ourselves and when in class we could ask questions however, the class was so large you were lucky to even get her attention! Definitely would not take if you do not have several hours to commit!
She teaches a flipped model style class which means you teach yourself and if you aren't this type a learner please please don't take it you will fail every test she gives because she doesn't teach

She was a great teacher. She uses a flipped style of teaching, where the student watches lectures at home, completes a quiz before class, and then works on the harder concepts in class with her and the SI instructor there to help. It takes time and effort to succeed-but I can honestly say that I KNOW the material and could use it in future classes.

a love-hate relationship. she's available for help, but she doesn't explain chemistry well. offers tons of work to help raise your grade, but theres homework due every day and quizzes (sometimes 2) almost every day! tests are 20 questions, so it's easy to screw up. flipped model classes are a waste of time, expect 6-10 hours a week.

lecture videos at home/class time was for questions and worksheets (not graded). Quizzes sometimes in class, only a small percentage of grade and easy. tests are pretty easy, doesn't try to trick you with close answers. easier than the homework, that can sometimes be hard. very willing to help. take her if you can. if your willing to work: A+.

Dr. Head is awesome! She really goes the extra mile for her students. Sh is the most student friendly professor I have ever had. She really knows her stuff. If you are struggling, just ask! She really wants everyone to pass. Be ready for a lot of work though. But if you do all the work and do everything she asks of you, the tests are a breeze.

Dr. Head is the such an awesome teacher! There are no lectures, which is great. Class time is for discussing homework or key parts of  reading assignments. Expect to take notes; be well ahead of class work. Your syllabus is your best friend!!! Her hours are flexible and she will stop at nothing to make sure that all of her students pass her class.

She had us watch videos at home and do worksheets in class(flip model classroom) Class was chaotic and difficult to concentrate on any work tests were 20 questions so you can only miss 2 questions to get an A. LOTS of homework required. She has u take ridiculous Quizzes b4 every class and at the beginning of each class. Barely teaches. Awful class!
